name: TheAtlantic
text: "The evidence is pointing in one direction. Schools do not, in fact, appear to be a major spreader of COVID-19," @ProfEmilyOster writes: https://t.co/djetU9fyAf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "The message of the president’s bare face is clear: It refuses to acknowledge the preferences—or the needs—of other people." https://t.co/Ft1OO2UufN

name: TheAtlantic
text: The biggest factors @HillaryClinton blames for her loss—disinformation, Vladimir Putin, and America’s deep political divide—will still be problems even if Trump loses, the 2016 Democratic presidential nominee tells @IsaacDovere: https://t.co/4r6zO0PAqv

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: .@HillaryClinton on her collapse with pneumonia in 2016 vs Trump now: "It’s apples and oranges, completely. When I was diagnosed with walking pneumonia, I was immediately put on antibiotics. I was told that I was not contagious" https://t.co/t8fCmxzgYs

name: TheAtlantic
text: In her sparkling new Netflix film, “The 40-Year-Old Version,” Radha Blank invokes the style of Judd Apatow and Spike Lee to tell a breezy story about overcoming creative frustration, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/mvKPFnYeuI

name: TheAtlantic
text: The experts recanted their interviews. Fact-checkers debunked it. So why do so many people think that masks can make you sick? @olgakhazan investigates: https://t.co/mMHKXe0KS9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For all their grandeur, written constitutions do not produce better democratic outcomes or help solve sophisticated societal problems," @bchristophjones writes: https://t.co/yZNnmh1gm8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @edyong209: I spoke to doctors, immunologists, linguists, anthropologists, and psychologists about what we're really talking about when we talk about "strength" in the context of "beating" disease, and whether there's any truth to that (very common) idea. 2/ https://t.co/3VULnpDfQQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump keeps looking for a silver bullet to end the pandemic. Monoclonal antibodies might be promising, but they are still far from a “cure.” @sarahzhang reports: https://t.co/ZFltLxjxeT

name: TheAtlantic
text: He boiled strings, cut vibrato bars in half, put the head of one guitar on the body of another—and created a sound that changed rock forever. James Parker remembers Eddie Van Halen: https://t.co/g89NK9oJEG

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: You can't beat up a virus. "Equating disease with warfare, and recovery with strength, means that death and disability are linked to failure and weakness." -@edyong209 https://t.co/T55hcCapxi

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @sarahzhang: Now that hydroxychloroquine clearly doesn't work and vaccines won't be available until after the election, Trump is touting yet another silver bullet: monoclonal antibodies. 

Here's what we actually know about them and why they will be hard to get: 

https://t.co/4B8WiELaX6

text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Stop playing politics with people’s lives,” Mike Pence said during the vice-presidential debate, before posing maskless with fellow leaders. @megangarber on the Trump administration’s dangerous absurdities: https://t.co/J7thuQX8HS

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some experts have reservations about rapid antigen tests—and the White House's cavalier attitude toward these tests has realized those fears, @alexismadrigal and @yayitsrob write: https://t.co/32IK2chvpA
